elements.title: A Honeymoon in Space (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that George Griffith's 1901 novel A Honeymoon in Space contains what may be the first space suits in fiction (pictured)?

elements.title: Grant DuBose (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that before being a top player at a Division I FBS school, wide receiver Grant DuBose worked bagging groceries and saw limited playing time for a Division II team?

elements.title: Elizabethan Book of Common Prayer (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that to prevent bishops from opposing the Elizabethan Book of Common Prayer, reformers had the entire papalist party arrested during a debate?

elements.title: Oscar James Campbell Jr. (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Oscar James Campbell Jr., an American scholar of Shakespeare, complained in 1926 that PhD students of English had to read "masses of stupid and essentially insignificant material"?

elements.title: Geneva Declaration (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the prime minister of Serbia signed the 1918 Geneva Declaration after intervention from the President of France?

elements.title: That's 60s (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the first song played on That's 60s was the same song Tony Blackburn had played on BBC Radio 1 more than 55 years earlier?

elements.title: Joanne Marrow (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that a university student sought counseling from his pastor after attending a guest lecture on sexuality by lesbian and former novice Joanne Marrow?

elements.title: 1987 Bullingdon Club photograph (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the BBC commissioned a painting of a 1987 Bullingdon Club photograph featuring David Cameron and Boris Johnson to circumvent copyright protection?
